column2: Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan sorcerer. Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation, too many attempts at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons. There can be np doubt he was utterly insane.
Jaffar is a vainglorious man, it is no wonder then that the prestigious camel is one of his favourite mounts to ride into battle.
From on top the howdah of a mighty Arabyan Royal Elephant, Sultan Jaffar gazes down upon the battlefield with only imperious cruelty and disdain in his eyes.
